DataElement.preferredName: Cognitive Assessment Performed CARTOX 10 Point Neurological Assessment Or Immune Effector Encephalopathy - ICE Assessment Lowest Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the lowest score for the CARTOX 10 point neurological assessment or Immune Effector Encephalopathy - ICE assessment cognitive assessment performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The examination of the cognitive capacities or deficits of an individual through the application of tests that probe that individual's ability to perform various mental activities such as perception, learning, and reasoning._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The examination of the cognitive capacities or deficits of an individual through the application of tests that probe that individual's ability to perform various mental activities such as perception, learning, and reasoning.

Concepts.definition: The examination of the cognitive capacities or deficits of an individual through the application of tests that probe that individual's ability to perform various mental activities such as perception, learning, and reasoning.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CARTOX 10 Point Neurological Assessment Or Immune Effector Encephalopathy - ICE Assessment Lowest Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A test to monitor for neurotoxicity related to CAR T therapy: orientation to year, month, city, hospital, and President; ability to name 3 specified objects; ability to write a standard sentence; ability to count backwards from 100 by 10._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A grading system for Immune Effector Cell Associated Neurotoxicity Syndrome that includes: orientation to year, month, city, hospital; ability to name objects; ability to follow simple commands; ability to write a standard sentence; and ability to count backwards from 100 by 10. Grading ranges from 10: no impairment to 0: patient unarousable and unable to perform ICE assessment._In the lowest position, nearest the ground, at the bottom; minimal in magnitude, lowest in rank or importance; an extreme state of adversity._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
